sentences: Desiree Coleman  aka Kadesh (From, Jamaica, Queens, New York, United States) is an American vocalist and actress.
Coleman is also the founder of Love Culture Center in Los Angeles, California.
Coleman came on the scene replacing Tisha Campbell in the longest running Off-Broadway musical production of Mama, I Want to Sing!, in 1983.
Desiree's mother on hearing her daughter's voice encouraged her to join the St. Luke Baptist Church choir in Queens, New York.
During her growing years, she did several commercials and by age fourteen became a part of a community choir called the Soul Searchers of New York City.
In 2006, Coleman recorded a song with WWE called, "Holla", which later became the entrance music for WWE Diva, Kelly Kelly.
